result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yosef B Patrick

records.addlTxt: 9:19 AM Defendant Yosef B Patrick in court.   Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Yosef B Patrick.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin.  DE unsure about offer, defense requesting Status Conference, court set trial dates.

Jury status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Jury selection on January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Yosef B Patrick in court with attorney Dominic Richards. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Offer given, set for a 2nd STC.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin

Defendant called Collections today to apply for county appointed attorney -  to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Latoya P. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:55 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.
